headline: NIKE, Inc. Declares $0.40 Quarterly Dividend
summary: BEAVERTON, Ore., August 07, 2025--NIKE, Inc. (NYSE: NKE) announced today that its Board of Directors has declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.40 per share on the Company’s outstanding Class A and Class B Common Stock payable on October 1, 2025, to shareholders of record at the close of business on September 2, 2025.

headline: lululemon Navigates FX Swings & Demand Shifts: Can It Stay Nimble?
summary: LULU leans on China growth, innovation and cost control to counter FX pressure, cautious U.S. demand and a shrinking gross margin in fiscal 2025.

headline: NORDSTROM IGNITES NYC'S RUNNING SCENE WITH NIKE RUNNING @ THE CORNER
summary: Nordstrom NYC is redefining the running experience with the launch of Nike Running @ The Corner: a limited-time pop-up shop that celebrates the latest Nike innovation, community and running. Located at the corner of 57th and Broadway, the shop offers Nike performance footwear and apparel to serve every type of runner — including the new road running lineup designed with a focus on the cushioning runners care about most. headline: Maersk boosts profit outlook as container demand defies trade fears
summary: COPENHAGEN (Reuters) -Shipping group Maersk raised its full-year profit forecast on Thursday as robust global container demand defied fears that tariffs would hit trade, although the company predicted a slowdown later this year.  Maersk, viewed as a barometer of world trade, said it now expected global container volumes to increase by 2% to 4% this year, compared with a range of down 1% to up 4% estimated in May. The new range implies lower second-half growth, it said.  A drop in U.S. imports after President Donald Trump unleashed a barrage of tariffs on foreign goods "was more than offset" by strong growth in imports into other regions, including Europe, the Danish firm said in its second-quarter earnings statement.
